abstract.text: A distinct voice for use in speech synthesis.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The primary factors that distinguish a voice in speech synthesis are language, locale, and quality. Create an instance of
to select a voice that’s appropriate for the text and the language, and set it as the value of the
instance. The voice may optionally reflect a local variant of the language, such as Australian or South African English. For a complete list of supported languages, see

abstract.text: Play, record, and process audio; configure your app’s system audio behavior.
A distinct voice for use in speech synthesis.
Traits that describe a voice.
A dictionary that contains audio file settings.
Returns the language and locale code for the user’s current locale.
The gender for a voice.
The unique identifier of a voice.
Retrieves a voice for the identifier you specify.
Retrieves a voice for the BCP 47 code language code you specify.
A BCP 47 code that contains the voice’s language and locale.
The name of a voice.
The speech quality of a voice.
Retrieves all available voices on the device.
The traits of a voice.
The gender for a voice.
The voice that the system identifies as Alex.
The speech quality of a voice.
An object that encapsulates the text for speech synthesis and parameters that affect the speech.
The voice the speech synthesizer uses when speaking the utterance.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
